hike.name: Daniel – Tuftl Alm Runde von Ehrwald Zugspitzbahn
hike.required_condition: Very good fitness, good sure-footedness, sturdy footwear, and alpine experience required.
hike.notes: Includes a section with potentially dangerous terrain requiring specific equipment and prior knowledge.

highlights.name: Upsspitze
highlights.description: A sub-peak of the famous Daniel. Recommended to include it in a small circular tour when climbing Daniel.

highlights.name: Daniel
highlights.description: The view from Daniel is breathtaking, offering direct views of the Zugspitze and an impressive panoramic view over the valley and surrounding mountains.

highlights.name: Annika-Grat
highlights.description: Transition from Upsspitze to Daniel, requiring good sure-footedness and no fear of heights. A short section requires hand assistance, but difficulty does not exceed the I. climbing grade.

highlights.name: Mega Aussicht
highlights.description: An incredible view point that is highly recommended by hikers.

highlights.name: Tuftl Alm
highlights.description: A lovely alpine hut with fantastic views over Lermoos and Ehrwald. Offers great food in a rustic dining room.

highlights.name: Blick über die Alm auf die Zugspitze
highlights.description: Wonderful view over the Alm with the Zugspitze in the background. A quieter spot for enjoying the view.

highlights.name: Bank mit wunderschöner Aussicht
highlights.description: A bench with a beautiful view of Ehrwald and the Mieminger Chain.

highlights.name: Tiroler Zugspitz Arena
highlights.description: The Tiroler Zugspitz Arena is located in the shadow of the Zugspitze at 2,962 meters on the Austrian side, comprising seven towns.

hike.accessibility: The starting point is accessible by public transport.
hike.recommended_for: Experienced hikers with good physical condition, alpine experience, and proper equipment.
